Package com.clientwallet.controller

Class WalletController

java.lang.Object
com.clientwallet.controller.WalletController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/wallet") @Validated public class WalletController extends Object
WalletController is a REST controller that provides API endpoints for wallet-related operations. These operations include creating a wallet, retrieving wallet details, depositing funds, withdrawing funds, transferring funds between wallets, and fetching transaction history.

  • Method Details

    • create

      @PostMapping("/create") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Wallet> create(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid WalletCreateRequest request)
      Creates a new wallet based on the provided details.

      This method accepts a request body containing the wallet name and currency, performs validation, and creates a new wallet in the system. It returns the created wallet in the response.

      Parameters:
      request - The request containing wallet creation details such as name and currency.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the created wallet object.
      Throws:
      WalletCreateWalletWithNameAlreadyExistsException - if a wallet with the same name already exists.

    • get

      @GetMapping("/get") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Wallet> get(@RequestParam UUID walletId)
      Retrieves the details of a wallet by its unique wallet ID.

      This method accepts a wallet ID as a request parameter, fetches the wallet from the system, and returns the wallet's details. If the wallet with the specified ID is not found, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      walletId - The unique identifier of the wallet to be fetched.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the wallet details.
      Throws:
      WalletNotFoundException - if the wallet with the specified ID does not exist.

    • deposit

      @PostMapping("/deposit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Transaction> deposit(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid WalletDepositRequest request)
      Deposits funds into a wallet.

      This method accepts a request containing deposit details, including the wallet ID, amount, currency, etc., performs the deposit, and returns a transaction object representing the deposit.

      Parameters:
      request - The request containing deposit details including wallet ID, amount, currency, etc.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the created transaction for the deposit.
      Throws:
      WalletNotFoundException - if the wallet with the specified ID does not exist.
      WalletDepositFailedException - if the deposit fails due to any reason.
      WalletDepositCurrencyMissMatchException - if there is a currency mismatch between the wallet and the deposit.

    • withdraw

      @PostMapping("/withdraw") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Transaction> withdraw(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid WalletWithdrawRequest request)
      Withdraws funds from a wallet.

      This method accepts a request containing withdrawal details, including the wallet ID, amount, currency, etc., performs the withdrawal, and returns a transaction object representing the withdrawal.

      Parameters:
      request - The request containing withdrawal details including wallet ID, amount, currency, etc.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the created transaction for the withdrawal.
      Throws:
      WalletNotFoundException - if the wallet with the specified ID does not exist.
      WalletWithdrawFailedException - if the withdrawal fails due to any reason.
      WalletWithdrawCurrencyMissMatchException - if there is a currency mismatch between the wallet and the withdrawal.
      WalletWithdrawNotEnoughFundsException - if the wallet does not have sufficient balance for the withdrawal.

    • transfer

      @PostMapping("/transfer") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Transaction> transfer(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid WalletTransferRequest request)
      Transfers funds from one wallet to another.

      This method accepts a request containing transfer details, including the sender and receiver wallet IDs, amount, currency, etc. It performs the transfer and returns a transaction object representing the transfer.

      Parameters:
      request - The request containing transfer details including sender and receiver wallet IDs, amount, currency, etc.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the created transaction for the transfer.
      Throws:
      WalletNotFoundException - if either of the wallets with the specified IDs do not exist.
      WalletTransferFailedException - if the transfer fails due to any reason.
      WalletTransferCurrencyMissMatchException - if there is a currency mismatch between the wallets and the transfer.
      WalletTransferNotEnoughFundsException - if the sender wallet does not have enough balance to complete the transfer.

    • getWalletHistory

      @GetMapping("/getHistory") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Transaction>> getWalletHistory(@RequestParam UUID walletId)
      Retrieves the transaction history of a wallet.

      This method accepts a wallet ID as a request parameter and returns a list of all transactions associated with that wallet.

      Parameters:
      walletId - The unique identifier of the wallet whose transaction history is to be fetched.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing a list of transactions associated with the wallet.
